Articles.Content:
I'm having trouble figuring out how the mass of a fairing is calculated. During procedural shaping mass (and cost) is indicated and it is reflected in the Engineer's Report. However, once on the launchpad, the mass of a fairing seems to be not included, according to map view Info button, and the performance observation.

For example, an LV-T45 can easily lift 60+ tons of fairings at sea level, when I would expect no more than 15-ish.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/bsmfY)

Any ideas?

All the "mass" of the fairing is considered to be in the fairing base at this time. I expect that is probably what you are noticing.

Yes, this means that there is no advantage to ditching the fairing sides. Another minor detail I am hoping will be addressed in the next patch.

Not quite what I'm getting at.

It seems to me that fairings have no mass at all other than the base, meaning that larger fairing is not more massive than a smaller one of the same base diameter.

LV-T45 should not be capable of lifting that fairing at all, no matter where the mass is concentrated.
